content.description:
The area classic, Bow Falls is early to form and stays around late in the season as it does not get any direct sun. It can be climbed as early as late October, although be aware that it will likely be thin ice with a huge amount of water flowing underneath until a couple months into the season.

Climb a couple pitches of low angle and possibly thin ice on slab up the huge shield, working your way climbers left into the final steeper pitch. Rappel to descend.



1 - 2 hour approach from the Bow Glacier parking lot. Follow the trail along the lakeside (or cut directly across the frozen lake) to the moraine containing the ice.

Standard ice rack.

The Bow Falls area is easily seen from the road and features a number of relatively safe, accessible, and early forming ice and mixed routes. The main attraction is Bow Falls itself, a high flow waterfall fed by the glacier above.
